title: David Donald (footballer)
text:
David Martin Donald (born 9 November 1987 in <a href="Aberdeen">Aberdeen</a>, Scotland) is a Scottish professional <a href="Association%20football">football</a> <a href="Defender%20%28association%20football%29">defender</a>, who has been without a club since leaving <a href="Peterhead%20F.C.">Peterhead</a> in 2012.
Donald started his career with <a href="Aberdeen%20F.C.">Aberdeen</a> and became the youngest player in their history when he made his debut on 15 May 2004 against <a href="Dundee%20F.C.">Dundee</a> at <a href="Pittodrie%20Stadium">Pittodrie</a>. He only made one other appearance for Aberdeen and he was <a href="free%20transfer%20%28football%29">released</a> at the end of the <a href="2006%E2%80%9307%20in%20Scottish%20football">2006-07 season</a>.
Donald was quickly signed by <a href="Peterhead%20F.C.">Peterhead</a> after his release by the Dons.
David went on to play for Woodside amateurs where he became a legend winning multiple titles
